Overview

Weather Analytics allows to consult the weather forecast for several cities in the world. You can also consult the weather from previous days and get metrics on average temperature, number of sunny days and more

Forecast History

This project started as a showcase of my font-end skill with AngularJS. It was also a good opportunity to deploy my first Play! app on Heroku.

Don't hesitate to check my code on the project's github repository.

Back-end

The back-end of this application is using the Play 2 Framework executed with Java 8. The API is written with as less blocking code as possible using Akka. Finally in order to facilitate the tests and the development, Google Guice is used for all the dependency injections.

Front-end

The front-end of this application is using AngularJS and Bootstrap. The graphics were generated using D3.js The front-end as an extensive set of unit tests that are executed by Karma every time we package the front-end using Grunt

Hosting

To host this application, Heroku was chosen because of its capacity to deploy Play applications simply by using Git. In a real production scenario, Heroku would even allow to scale the servers consumption depending on the evolution of the traffic. The source code of this application is available in Github on a public repository.
